item.title: Microsoft Launches Node.js Tools For Visual Studio | techno babble
item.description: Node.js allows developers to write their server-side applications in JavaScript and it looks like Microsoft has kept all the essentials in place. As Microsoft Web Platform Team member Scott Hanselman notes, the team ... to Visual Studio and will work in both the 2012 and 2013 editions of the IDE. If you want to give them a try, Hanselman's blog post also features a brief walk-through of editing (and running) the Node.js-based Ghost blogging platform's source code in Visual Studio.
item.dc:creator: shawn callahan
